Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2016 06:37AM Pandabear123 wrote: I can only tel you IBC is VERY rare. It accounts for 1-4% of all breast cancers. Your mother probably looked by now. But stay off line! It will only scare you. Every time I'm having a good day and I google... I get scared out of my mind. You cannot diagnose yourself like that. It could be a rash from something and now your probably touching it too much. Have your mom take a look. Maybe you need a dermatologist who can tell you if it's a skin issue. If not see your GP to write you a script for some imaging tests. But I bet it's nothing
Posts.Title: Red round splotch on right breast. Taylorcampbell1994 Kicks

Posts.Content: Oct 26, 2016 01:35PM Pandabear123 wrote: I'm no medical expert by ANYMEANS! But enhancement of the nipple and subareola region to me... Just mens he he took a closer look there? Like that was the area that he was focusing on. I'm guessing this is where your complaint was. In that area. I also think that birads 2 is benign. If your confused in any way( although I have to admit I'm blown away by the information that some of these women provide! Some more than others you can tell have done their research and are VERY informative) but don't be shy, reach back out to the radiologist and ask him to explain things in a simple way that you can understand. This is new to you and you are scared I have been bringing my boyfriend to my appointments incase there is something beyond simple they need to explain. He is much more calmer, and I know I'm too nervous in the moment to really hear what they are saying. I THINK birads one is no findings. And birads two is benign. I hope someone else chimes in here for you. But don't be scared to ask the radiologist or surgeon again. Maybe have someone else listen in as well keep us posted.
Posts.Title: MRI question? Scmommato3 Pandabear123

Posts.Content: Oct 26, 2016 05:10PM Pandabear123 wrote: just call back the radiologist. Don't be afraid to ask. I wouldn't even hesitate. I had my ultrasound and called the imaging center the very next morning to see if my results were sent to my GP. Then I called my GP to see if they received them and that I wanted the results. ( oddly, thankfully I called... They sent them to another GP's office with the same last name.). But I was not afraid to ask. I waited about three hours ( not too long, it's still a doctor office and I'm not the only patient) and my GP called me back. I can't help you with the terminology and diagnosis. But I can tell you that you have the right to have your results EXPLAINED to you. I confided in my brother in all of this... I was scared. But he had a brain tumor. Thank god it was benign. But he still had to have brain surgery and have it removed. He's a VERY smart guy. And very rational. But he told me.... Don't be afraid to ask questio√±s and ask about your results. I wish I could help you more. Good luck to you. I only pray for the best

Posts.Content: Oct 26, 2016 07:42AM Pandabear123 wrote: I wouldn't be shy. I don't know what any of that means.... But after my ultrasound I called my GP the next morning. Posts.Title: Time frame to diagnosis, worried. strength80 kjam

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2016 01:48PM Pandabear123 wrote: Hello there Brat12. I am also going through a scare and I also suffer from anxiety. So I understand. The crying, pit in stomachs, loss of appetite and I'm like a zombie all day. These women have the best advice... Keep busy and stay off google! It's not going to change a thing either way. Just make you crazy. Don't assume! Your taking the right steps to manage your healthcare. The waiting STINKS! But keep busy and try to stay positive. My doctor said all common things are common andMost breast changes are benign. But he's sending me for an ultra sound and an MRI anyway. Just to " cross the T's and dot the I's). I found an indent as well. TERRIFIED! Get your tests and see a specialist. I will be praying for good results for you!

But I don't see why you should have to.
Posts.Title: Hard Tissue mya28 Pandabear123

Posts.Content: Nov 2, 2016 11:21PM - edited Nov 2, 2016 11:27PM by Pandabear123 I'm getting a little better. I'm trying to be optimistic. And I do have BC in my family. My grandmother was diagnosed in her early 40's. But you know what.... They didn't have chemo then. She had a mastectomy and radiation. She's 93. It never resurfaced again. Stay calm.. You have no history, and actually.... Breasts cyst are supposed to be very painful and very common!So that may be good. Oh... And definitely avoid caffeine!!!! My mother had a painful cyst removed years ago. They told her to avoid caffeine. And it's true. MOST women that inquire about a lump or indent or whatever... They only have 1 to 10 posts. Sometimes just one or two. Because think about it.... You will be so happy that it was nothing. You wouldn't bother to come back and want to put it behind you. And you CERTAINLY wouldn't write a story about it!

Often the moderators respond with something for you as well. Good luck to you!
Posts.Title: ADH, Genetic Testing, Moles-Dysplastic Nevus ChelseaAcres momoschki

Posts.Content: Nov 14, 2016 05:52PM Pandabear123 wrote: My LAST post. I have to stay off for multiple reasons. I saw a specialist today. She reviewed my images with a radiologist and said everything looked, " beautiful". She saw the change and examined me as well. Normal tissue change. She advised me to call her with any concerns as opposed to going online. I apologize if I offended or caused any harm. Im a very good and peaceful person. That was never my intention. This is a VERY ( I don't know what other word use.... It's a good thing) SERIOUS forum. I reached out in a panicked state. I get what you are all saying. I do. Most members are very experienced, educated and factual. Very specific. I'm beyond impressed!!!! I was not doing that. I was feeding into the panicked ..." Oh no... It's okay, this is what I read and blah... Blah... Blah" with no experience or facts to base it on. Wrong. I was wrong. And I'm sorry, I hope I didn't cause any harm. I did post my update on the " dreaded indent" but I think I kept it very cool. As far as the anxiety/ADD thing. No. I have not been diagnosed. I'm in the process. I have been seeing a therapist for the last few months. And... Eh... I don't know how helpful it's been. I don't take any meds to ADJUST. And no, I CANNOT and I mean CANNOT read a book! I havent always been like that. But no, I cannot get through a page in a book, not one! Not a SINGLE page! So although I get your overall frustration with me. Like you said, no two are the same. I have my associates degree. I have tried over and over to get my bachelors. I CANNOT PAY ATTENTION!!!!!!! I'm an excellent worker! I work 4 12-13 hours shifts in a row on my feet in a very high volume restaurant. And oddly, I NEVER (very rarely) make mistakes( one of the few things I'm proud of) and I can work any position. ANY! Everything is done perfectly and cleaned on shift. This and cleaning my house are the only times I am focused and can pay attention! I NEED to be on my feet an very busy physically. So, am I ADD? I don't know? I'm trying to find out. So I'm not by any means knocking or judging ADD. That's just how I feel. PLEASE! I wish you all only the best health!!!! And much love! medicalpictures.net/wp-content... I ADD? I don't know? But I am trying to find out. So I greatly appreciate your advise. I'm not being a smart ass. You are all a bunch of great ladies looking out for the rest! Absolutely! But, you don't know my diagnosis either.
Posts.Title: Just thankful I found this site, but looking for info Pandabear123 BarredOwl

Posts.Content: Nov 2, 2016 10:37PM Pandabear123 wrote: I am going through a similar thing right now. I'm 41 years old, when I raise my arms above my head, I have a dent under my breast. No pain, thankfully no palable lump. But I understand. I had just had a routine mammo and exam in July and noticed this in August. I don't know how long it's been there. I didn't know it was a warning sign... Then I decided to look it up. I'm glad I did. Because it got me to the doctor. That wait was a week. Mammo was already done. Negative with heterogeneous dense tissue. Very common for us women in our 40's. But makes things more difficult to see. Then I waited another two weeks for ultra sound. Again. Negative. Nothing. She even went over the area again and again. Still my GP always advises to see a specialist. A second set of eyes looking things over and I don't know... Maybe more testing or hopefully a benign explanation. We shall see. The good thing is you are doing everything I a single day! I'm a little more calm now. But I get it. I couldn't eat sleep think or function. I can tell you this... STAY OFF GOOGLE! You don't know what type of info you are getting. It could be unreliable or out dated. It will only scare you. Remember most women that write about their anomalies are diagnosed. The benign situations don't tend to stick around to write about them. Although there are several women on this site with benign indents. It could be a benign tumor, a cyst(which is known to be painful), a fibrodenoma and there is a woman in here with a dent from ductal estasia. It can be an array of things. You will only know through testing and a good breast specialist. I will be thinking of you! Stay calm and stay off the internet

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2016 06:01PM - edited Nov 7, 2016 06:06PM by Pandabear123 thank you again for the information Bessie. No, I'm a mess and did not read through your information properly before responding. Im was on my phone and it was a pain to read at the moment on my stupid little phone. I was having a freak out moment. I did not mean to offend you with my terminology. Not at all! Please ... Not my intention. But I did read your FIRST paragraph. It was the last one I think you were referring to that I missed. When you advised me (wisely) not to use the word "boob". But we all make mistakes. Clearly. So please. I appreciate your information. But have some patience. Please. We are all new here. Worried, we don't always understand what we are reading. Then we read one thing... Then we read another. We are just scared. Or at least I am.

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2016 10:00PM Pandabear123 wrote: thank you Beesie. But I'm still confused. I THINK dense breasts are fibrocystic? Is it the same thing? But they found no cysts of any kind... I have my report and I don't think I have ever had a cyst. And WHAT is that lumpiness I feel all over both breasts? I never felt another pair if boobs, and by the way I'm ok with that... Lol. But why wouldn't someone along the way have explained any of this to me ? I feel like I'm COMPLETELY oblivious and I feel like an idiot. But no one ever bothered to tell me. I see it with so many other women in these boards. They get a routine exam and mammo and get sent away. It's frustrating. I was never shown or told about a proper self exam. Grrrr
Posts.Title: Just thankful I found this site, but looking for info Pandabear123 BarredOwl

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2016 05:41PM - edited Nov 7, 2016 05:50PM by Pandabear123 Thank you Barredowl. I will admit I'm responding before reading. I'm getting in the bath now and going to read. I took a break for a few days. And I feel TERRIBLE and hope I didn't offend anyone with my terminology. I'm just a mess on and off. And I have always used the word "boob" just like i never use the word "vagina". My intention was not to offend anyone. This would be an entire different discussion, but I was sexually abused from... Maybe 4 or 5 years old until... I don't remember. So there are things that go with that too. ALL SORTS of problems! Talking about private parts of the body, or getting through any type of breast or OBGYN exam is unbelievably uncomfortable! In fact, I asked my OBGYN about the implant. ( two different doctors) said, " no way!". They can barely examine me and were not willing to try. I never thought using the word" boobs" was offensive, but I get it. I appreciate ALL the information. Us new people may sound nuts and irrational... But we are in a state of panic. Then just when you think you are ok, someone chimes in..." My mammo and ultra sound were clear but my MRI/biopsy picked up my cancer.". I'm sorry. But thank you for having the patience with me.
Posts.Title: Just thankful I found this site, but looking for info Pandabear123 BarredOwl

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2016 08:52PM - edited Nov 12, 2016 09:07PM by Pandabear123 Anxiousrn, I haven't been on for a few days. It increases my anxiety. Everyone is very HELPFUL. But I do have a health anxiety and general anxiety disorder, so it's like a roller coaster. It can make me feel better, and it can fuel my anxiety. My boyfriend took the laptop and iPad away from me. Sounds childish... But probably necessary. Minday is my appointment with the specialist.üò≥ I have to check up on you. But I feel like you are fine. It is comforting to know someone else knows how you feel. I will check your posts. Bessie, I thank you again for even responding to me. But you have to understand, ( I'm not a calm person, and I can't speak for everyone) but the information is overwhelming. Usually when I'm on here... I'm having a panicked moment. So to focus and read ( and I'm on this stupid little phone now) its IMPOSSIBLE!!!!!! Quite honestly, I cannot read and obtain the information when I'm such a disaster. It's like having ADD and trying to read a book. I can't explain it. In fact, I ONLY just now got what you said, because you JUST pointed it out so clearly.Im trying to diagnose myself, basically. But I have a breast indent only when my arms are up, inner lower quadrant. So, I'm searching, squeezing, looking over and over and over.I know I cannot diagnose myself but I'm trying to. I also know no one on this site can either. But some people are logical, calm and rational... And then there is the rest of us. I'm sure you unfortunately remember going through this part. Your are just more rational and calm
Posts.Title: Just thankful I found this site, but looking for info Pandabear123 BarredOwl

Posts.Content: Nov 2, 2016 01:17PM Pandabear123 wrote: hopefully someone else with more knowledge on this will respond To you. I'm very sorry that you are going through this. And also sorry that your hubby isn't being so supportive. Sorry, but shame on him! First... You need the biopsy before the cancer diagnosis. Second, if it is ( I certainly hope it's not). You don't even know what kind of cancer or stage it is yet. I know several women who had BC and did not have a mastectomy. And other who did and have been around for many years living a full and happy life! My grandmother had a mastectomy 50 years ago. She's still here. She's 93! And at that time they probably only had mastectomy and radiation for treatment. I will be praying for you. In the mean time... Tell your husband that you are going to and DO need him right now. I'm sure god forbid... You would be there for him.
